user_request: see creations saved in the google photos
screen_desc: This screenshot displays the Google Photos app. It shows that there are no photos uploaded yet, with a camera icon indicating where photos would appear. The "Back up & sync" settings are highlighted, showing the current configuration: photos will be uploaded in high quality with free unlimited storage and only over Wi-Fi. The user’s account, "Ellie Brennan," is visible, and there’s a "Confirm" button at the bottom to finalize settings.
history_actions: click on the Photos app located at the upper left.

think_action.Thought: The user is attempting to view their creations saved in Google Photos. The current screen indicates that there are no photos uploaded yet, and the user has the 'Back up & sync' settings displayed. Since there are no photos showing, it seems the backup has not been completed. I will focus on completing the backup process to enable the user to view their photos.
Future Action Plan: Enable the backup and sync feature to start uploading photos.
Wait for the backup to complete or check if the user has photos uploaded.
Once the photos are uploaded, the user can see them in the app.
think_action.Next Single Step Action: Click on 'Confirm' to enable the backup and sync settings.
